title: Graph shows firm should increase output to 18

content.question: The diagram above shows a perfectly competitive firm's short-run cost curves. If the price of the output increases from $8 to $10, the profit-maximizing firm will

choices.label: continue producing 15 units because average total cost is a minimum
continue producing 15 units because average total cost is equal to marginal cost
increase output to 20 units because this is the output at which price equals average total cost
increase output to 18 units because this is the output at which price equals marginal cost
decrease output to 10 units because this is the output at which average variable cost is at a minimum

content.answer: increase output to 18 units because this is the output at which price equals marginal cost

unit.text: 3: Production, Cost, and the Perfect Competition Model

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
